activity.instructions: You are at an airport tourist information office.

item.audiotext: Good morning. How can I help you?
item.choice: Good morning. Could you give me some information?

item.audiotext: Yes, of course. What would you like to know?
item.choice: Is there a bus to the city centre?
I like to know about a bus to the city centre.
I need go to the city centre.

item.audiotext: Yes, just wait at the bus-stop for the number 9.
item.choice: Can you tell me where the bus-stop is?
I'd like to know the bus-stop.

item.audiotext: Go straight on. It's on your left.
item.choice: And how much is a ticket?

item.audiotext: It's £6.50 for one way and £12 return.
item.choice: OK, and is there a cashpoint near here?
What do I do for money?

item.audiotext: Yes, there's one just over there.
item.choice: Oh yes, I see it. Thank you.
Yes. Can you recommend a good restaurant?
Yes. You recommend a good restaurant?

item.audiotext: Go to the Market Centre. There are lots of good restaurants there.

activity.instructions: You are talking to a classmate.

item.audiotext: Hi. Did you have a good weekend?
Yes. I've been learning how to fly an aeroplane.
item.choice: Did you? What was it like?

item.audiotext: It was fantastic. We flew over the city!
item.choice: That's amazing! Where did you learn?

item.audiotext: My friend John is a pilot and he has a flying school.
item.choice: Really? How long did it take you to learn?

item.audiotext: It took about ten lessons. I was terrible at first.
But I improved. John let me fly alone for one minute.
It was the best weekend I've had for a long time!
